answers.answer: This reflects autoimmune thyroid disease (which is what caused the hyperthyroidism in the past) -- if TSH and T4 are normal, this does not usually require treatment, but the risk of future thyroid dysfunction is higher -- either hypo or recurrent hyper.
Thank you so very much for your precious time. Is there something i should do to stop the onset of these two? like prevention is better than cure...

question: hello doctor,i was diagnosed with hyperthyroidism in 2005 and given ptu as treatment. i gave birth 2006 to my 3rd child while i'm on that medication but stopped a month b4 my due date as per my ob-gyne docs order. since then i have'nt taken any meds for my thyroid b/c my blood result showed normal. 2011 i have hysterectomy due to heavy bleeding that resulted in severe anemia. yesterday, i went to see my endo doc for my regular check-up for my thyroid and diabetes. doc said, everything in my blood works look normal but i am vit d deficient. my out of range  blood works:glucose-109 higha1c- 6.0 highhdl- 39 lowvit d, 25-hydroxy total- 17 Lowmirosomal tpo-ab- 835 highaside from these, i have 2 nodules in my right and left thyroid which remains at 4. something mm. my doc said, he will not gave me any meds for my thyroid b/c i don't need it this time but prescribed vit d2 50,000. when i came home and review my blood work i found my  microsomal tpo is so high and out of range of <35IU/ml. Don't you think, he should mentioned it to me and explained what is that about?  i always complain of being tired but always ignored. its like my spirit is willing but my flesh is weak syndrome...ava
title: microsomal tpo-ab  @  835 high?
